ALLEGATION: School teachers, who are contracted with the agency, are
being used at the facility as maintaining staffing ratios and this is in violation
of PREA.
INVESTIGATION:
On 12/6/20, I initiated the investigation. I spoke to the complainant and Administrator 1.
On 12/10/19, I spoke to Complainant 1. Complainant 1 reported the agency was in
noncompliance of PREA standards due to allowing teachers to be counted in the
staffing ratio. Complainant 1 reported that the teachers are contractual staff and are not
employees of the facility. Complainant 1 stated since they are contractual staff they
cannot be counted in the staffing ratio as direct care workers.
On 12/17/19, I spoke to Administrator 1, Vice President of Residential Programs.
Administrator 1 reported teachers are used to provide “line of sight” when needed.
Administrator 1 reported that teachers are not scheduled as part of the staffing ratio.
On 1/9/20, I spoke to Administrator 2, Program Supervisor. Administrator 2 reported
their program requires a 1:5 staff-to-resident ratio. Administrator 2 reported teachers are
not placed on the staffing schedule to supervise residents. Teachers will be designated
as a second staff to fulfill the staff-to-resident ratio at times. During school, teachers are
sometimes used in the staffing ratio when one youth care worker will take residents to
use the bathroom during school hours and will be used in off grounds school field trips.
I reviewed the teacher Job Description from Vassar Public Schools. There is not a job
description created for the teachers by Wolverine Vassar House, therefore; the job
description did not list maintaining “line of supervision” of residents in the absence of a
sufficient number of Wolverine staff members.
I reviewed the contract between Wolverine Human Services and Vassar Public Schools.
The contract states the educational staff will be trained and involved in physical
restraints and incident report writing.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4111 Job Description
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and
lines of authority.
3

ANALYSIS: Vassar House does not have a job description in the teacher’s
personnel file. The contract between Wolverine Human Services
and Vassar Public Schools does not denote teachers can be
utilized as direct care workers.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff to student ratio
(1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written
staff-to-resident ratio formula for direct care workers
ANALYSIS: Teachers are used in the staff-to-resident ratio at times.
Teachers do not have a job description that identifies their role
as being part of the staff-to-resident ratio.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
A. It is recommended the license remain unchanged.
